chapter.title: Coding Style Guide
chapter.para: In order to preserve the consistent development of OTRS project we have set up a few guidelines regarding style.

sect1.title: Formatting
sect1.para: TAB: We use 4 spaces. Braces examples:

sect1.title: Naming
sect1.para: Names and comments are written in English. Variables, Objects and Methods must be descriptive nouns or noun phrases with the first letter upper case.

sect1.title: Source Code Header and Charset
sect1.para: Attach the folowing header to each source file. Source files are saved in Charset ISO-8859-1.

sect1.title: Version Comments
sect1.para: Often functions in the current framework version aren't available. So sometimes settings have to changed, if a new module and framework version will be released. If you use version comments you can grep after changes whitch have to do, when a new version will be published. The keyword for version comments is 'FRAMEWORK'. For perl use '#' and for xml use the xml comments.
sect1.programlisting: e.g. for perl-code # FRAMEWORK-2.1 the function ID2UserName is primal available in OTRS 2.1
